WRITING.TITLE: Snow remained where the sun didn't reach

WRITING.TEXT: Cheers for saying that - it's like people in this thread are doing the very thing they complain about the panel doing.

hehehe! Gottfrid r fr vrigt inte hktad lngre, misstanken fr dataintrnget lades ner. S just nu sitter han av straffet fr TPB (vilket de veckor han satt hktad fr dataintrnget inte fr rknas av frn, lattjo nog).

Yes, but regardless of the laws - people are filesharing, and content is available "for free". This is where the argument that "nobody would pay" fails. Because they do, despite having access to products for free. The various research that has been performed these past ten years, show that filesharers -- those that download pirated copies -- are those that makes the most purchases. Here you can find a long list of unbiased research: http://www.laquadrature.net/wiki/Studies_on_file_sharing
There might be a moral argument in not allowing filesharing, but the argument that "nobody would pay" has simply been refuted, over and over again. I figure there needs to be a change in the mindset what constitutes a "product" to charge money for. I'm kind of partial to Neil Gaiman's take (who, I think borrowed the comparison from Cory Doctorow) that filesharing is like spreading the seeds of a dandelion. Some just "goes away", other finds a place to root. A rather lovely way of explaining how one needs to regard the entertainment business. Musicians' music becomes a flyer, of sorts, to let people know about them. Authors finds readers -- an authors biggest fear isn't necessarily that noone *buys* the book, it's rather that noone *reads* the book.
A rather difficult business in the entertainment industry is the movie sector. Those are usually quite cost heavy, and although Kevin Smith has experimented with an alternative method, I think that it's rather difficult to come up with ideas. However, the industry *has* shown a remarkable growth - regardless that people download the movies. Personally, I check in on The Pirate Bay's Top-100 list, to check out what is worth watching, these days...
Another side of this problem is also, that the basic -- well, lie, that filesharers' simply wouldn't pay for content, is the fact that copyright is being used as means to incite censorship. Also, there's a matter of proportion that is highly worrysome. The relentless escalation of how hurtful filesharing is, might have caused a young man to commit suidice recently. Perhaps you've heard about Aaron Swartz?
This discussion needs to take all these matters (and more, that I haven't even mentioned) into consideration, if you ask me.

Tycker det r en intressant synpunkt. Innan internet (ja, jag r s gammal) s hade jag helt klart viftat bort pstenden om att mn skulle vara verrepresenterade i kategorin mobbare. Helt p egna anektdotiska erfarenheter, ska sgas. Ens egna verklighet r ju typ det enda man har som referensram. Men, sen jag brjade hnga p internet fr tio-tolv r sedan har jag blivit frfrad allt oftare - de sista ren praktiskt taget dagligen - ver det oresonliga hat fr kvinnor som finns. Bara fr att de r kvinnor. Hr p Reddit blir jag inte minst deprimerad mellan varven, ver den sociala konsensus som rder kring just kvinnor. (Jag pstr inte att det inte hnder mn ocks - andra grupper r, som exempelvis s.k. "neckbeards" el.dyl., som drabbas av versitteri med jmna mellanrum.) En konstant r dock att kvinnor liksom... suger, om ordvits ursktas. Det har blivit ett slags socialt klister, att vara lagom misogyn till daglig-dags, och det eskalerar rtt kvickt mellan varven. S just p internet, p stora populra plattformar, framtrder just mn som en problemgrupp p ett stt som jag aldrig hade trott kunnat frekomma. S jag r inte frvnad ver att mn framstr som extra skyldiga, eller s, baserat p folks generella erfarenheter frn sg tuben osv. Visst behver ntmobbing och nthat tas upp som helhet, jag tror emellertid att vi alla mste skmmas offentligt, s att sga, freg med gott exempel, steppa upp nr saker eskalerar. Vi behver nog alla bita i det sura pplet fr jag gissar att det ligger i sakens natur att det aldrig nnsin kommer att bli "acceptabelt frdelade frutsttningar" fr att kmpa mot versitteri. Man fr nysta dr man str, typ.

I apologize in advance if this is a stupid question; but how on earth can an adsl-provider see exactly which files are being downloaded by a customer? I totally get if you can see an increase in traffic or whatnot, but so exact, how is that technically possible? And how does that work with American(?) laws regarding privacy?

"Letting oneself" go, is one of those popular misconceptions that is difficult to tackle. Therefore it's easier with an accident, it's usually not thought of as self imposed. (Even if it's something somebody injured might be partly responsible for.) However, general psykological problems are usually not something that you can help. It's kind of like saying "man up" to someone suffering from depression. Which I think most people are starting to realize is a totally inadequate advice. In such cases, the choice of hanging on to somebody with the problems is entirely your own responsibility. Do you have the stamina and/or the will to pull through it. Everybody aren't cut out for the kind of loyalty and patience physical och psychological problems demands, obviously.
Anyways, whatever the problems are in a relationship it does require both of them to be a part of the solution in most cases. I'd definately recommend going to a therapist, or somebody with professional know how, in order to resolve it instead of seeking advice on a public forum where everybody has opinions rather than knowledge.

Of course you are being shallow. People write a lot about underlying issues in this thread, which probably is correct. Try to approach the subject from another angle; consider if you are in an accident which leads to your wife having to deal with your physical short comings. An accident, may be easier to "accept", but truth is, suffering from emotional problems and stress is just as serious condition to deal with. You make it sound like this isn't about you, but it's all about you. Wether you leave her, or decide to stay on, it's your decision. Making it her responsibility like this, makes me believe that you quite possibly are one of the underlying problems. If you want to fix this problem you should try to find a marriage counselor, not make it your wife's responsibility. ((edit: spelling))
Kollegorna p jobbet ser inte alls samma problem som jag gr sjlv. Inte helt konstigt d, kanske, att de missade denna, vad man nu ska kalla det, felsyftning?

Anna Troberg skriver inte (och jag antar tror inte heller) att utlmning r ett reellt hot, hon beskriver dremot varfr det inte r konstigt att folk (och kanske framfr allt Assange) tror att det r det. Hon beskriver snarare problemet med att han vver de hr historierna och det vackra med ppenheten i wikileaks skitas ner, nr han sjlv inte r lika ppen fr granskning.

Bodstrm friades av KU, ungefr fr att han sa "att det inte var s" att han begtt ministerstyre. Jag skulle jttegrna bidra med en lnk, men dr informationen fanns tidigare har [tagits bort](http://www.riksdagen.se/webbnav/?nid=3322 doktyp=bet rm=2007/08 bet=KU6 dok_id=GV01KU6) frn deras hemsida... :( ID-numret leder till [den hr sidan](http://www.riksdagen.se/sv/Dokument-Lagar/Utskottens-dokument/Betankanden/Arenden/200708/KU6/); den har jag dessvrre inte lst och kan inte konfirmera r korrekt KU-mte. Hr lnk till [Justitieombudsmannens uttalande](http://www.jo.se/Page.aspx?MenuId=106 MainMenuId=106 Language=sv ObjectClass=DynamX_SFS_Decision Id=2275) dr han kom fram till att det inte handlade om ministerstyre.

The "poor excuse" for this video is that it's a competition piece, made and edited by a director according to the [rules of the competition](http://focusforwardfilms.com/) (which is presenting people behind inventions), and it's not a product video. So I guess you'll forgive those that didn't read your comment properly, seeing how you in turn, misunderstood the purpose of this video.
I wonder how long, before the lyrics of this song will need some sort of translation to kids listening to it for the first time?
Yeah, it's a director that put this up in a [film short-competition](http://focusforwardfilms.com/films/49/) where the rules are to present people behind inventions.
